text: Kypseli () is a small mountainous village in the region of Kastoria, northern Greece. According to the 2011 Greek census, the village had 86 inhabitants. == Demographics & Names == According to the statistics of the Bulgarian geographer Vasil Kanchov, the village had 680 Orthodox Greek inhabitants in 1900.Kanchov, Vasil, , Sofia, 1900, p. 268. Written as "Селско". (in Bulgarian) In 1926, the village got renamed from Pseltskon to Kypseli.ΦΕΚ 413 / 22.11.1926 The majority of the inhabitants of the village moved to Kastoria and Maniakoi in 1970s.Δημήτρη Λιθοξόου, Οικισμοί της Καστοριάς που αρχίζουν από Π, last one. == References == == External links == *Video showing the village from a drone Category:Populated places in Kastoria (regional unit)
title: Kypseli, Kastoria
